result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Joseph Robert Ladd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution was pre-paid in full prior to the disposition of this sentence.
Anticipated court costs of $518 were prepaid by credit card in full prior to the disposition of this case.  All that remains owed is the 5% surcharge.

Time-served after good time credit applies.

Burnett County case 16CF29 was dismissed, but read-in for sentencing purposes.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Joseph Robert Ladd

records.addlTxt: Motion and proposed order to withdraw as counsel
Full restitution sent

01:07 PM Cases 15CF111 and 16CF29 called together.  Defendant, Justin Joseph Robert Ladd, appeared with Attorney Dan Firkus.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Justin Joseph Robert Ladd appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Restitution supplement has been filed with a letter.  Court reviews signed PLQ.  Agreement is recited by Atty Firkus- def pleading to Ct 2 in 15CF111 (to be amended to misdemeanor possession of stolen property)- joint recommendation of costs only, restitution, and 33 days jail (time served).  State makes basis for agreement.  State moves to amend Count 2 of 15CF111 to misdemeanor possession of stolen property; granted.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Defs constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea.  Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of amended Ct 2 of 15CF111 and orders a JOC; remaining counts and 16CF29 are DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def (does/does not make) statement to the Court.  
Court orders:
$3,000 restitution j/s w/co-defendant
$518 court costs total
(All costs and restitution prepaid)
33 days jail (time served), 25 days jail credit  
Appeal rights provided.  State assures VR compliance.  DNA ordered (done).
Supplement to Dispositional Order (Restitution)
Supplement to Dispositional Order (Restitution)
DA letter RE: restitution
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 6, 2021 at 01:00 pm.

01:23 PM Defendant, Justin Joseph Robert Ladd, appeared with Attorney Dan Firkus.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.   Justin Joseph Robert Ladd appeared by video means with Attorney appearing in person.  Case was on for adjourned plea hearing, but no restitution information has been filed (confusion with co-defendant's payments, etc); this will be adjourned again for DA to get restitution information together and filed.  Atty Firkus and defendant are approved for Zoom appearance.  VW coordinator and State must appear in person for next plea/sentencing date.  Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 6, 2021 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 16, 2021 at 01:00 pm.

11:17 AM Cases 15CF111 and 16CF29 called together.  Defendant, Justin Joseph Robert Ladd, appeared with Attorney Dan Firkus.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Cases are on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Firkus: def pleading G to amended Count 2 in 15CF111: misdemeanor receiving stolen property, joint recommendation of costs and 33 days jail credit for 25 days jail; bond to cover, remaining cases/charges to be DRI.  Atty Firkus argues in support of the agreement.  Discussion of restitution.  Court to reset so parties can be better prepared.  Def to go downstairs and ensure that the Sheriff's Department has his DNA on file before leaving the building.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2021 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2021 at 11:00 am.

09:47 AM Cases 15CF111 and 16CF29 called together.  Defendant, Justin Joseph Robert Ladd, appeared with Attorney Dan Firkus.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Justin Joseph Robert Ladd appeared by video means with Attorneys appearing in person.  Cases on for status conference.  Atty Firkus updates the Court: agreement reached, requesting plea/sentencing.  No offer to recite at this time, but it is figured out; needs a few weeks to get the details ironed out.  Next hearing must be all in person, def understands.  State makes statement.  Bond continues.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2021 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on September 16, 2021 at 09:30 am.

03:49 PM Cases 15CF111 and 16CF29 called together.  Defendant, Justin Joseph Robert Ladd, appeared with Attorney Dan Firkus.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Def by phone.  Atty Firkus by video.  Case 16CF29 on for waiver of prelim, 15CF111 on for status conference.  Def waives personal appearance KIV.  Case 16CF20 proceeds to Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State efiles information.  Proceeds to arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Phone appearance for def approved for next hearing.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2021 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on August 16, 2021 at 03:45 pm.

Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant, Justin Joseph Robert Ladd, appeared with Attorney Dan Firkus.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  WTLPH.  Atty Firkus updates: discussions continue, awaiting discovery in 2016 cases.  If def is waiving prelim at next date, may appear by phone or video, if a preliminary hearing will go as scheduled, will need to appear in person.  Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2021 at 03:45 pm.
